item.title: The Git Cheatsheet
item.description: Setting up a git repo locally The easy way install VScode and setup git addon/plug-in Short way ! Make a folder through GUI copy link of git repo inside the folder, open git bash with right click, then type git clone git@git....git Now your git repo is set ! The long way Make a folder through GUI or terminal # Making folder through terminal (optional) #For Mac/Windows Git bash mkdir newFolder #change directory to new folder (optional) cd newFolder Initiating local git floder in “newFolder” #NOTE: default branch now is 'master' git init adding remote repo, and naming it locally as ‘origin’ #the link is supposed to be git repo link git remote add origin git@git.

item.title: Starting With C
item.description: These are a few of my notes studying C from books such as Effective C as practice an king’s book C99 practice questions Note that I will be summarizing these notes even more with second draft, and then I’d rewrite them in a more friendly manner the third time pages: 0-12(13) of Effective C Objectives: Build a simple C program Compile and run the simple C program Compiler options Portiablity Issues Quick Read Takeaways Simple hello world program #include <stdio.
